It did take slightly longer to install but the saving was worth the time.I immediately turned off auto renew on the newly purchased product. Two months later I received an email saying that if I switched on auto renew I would get an extra 3 months of cover. Name: Norton 360 Deluxe 2024, Antivirus software for 5 Devices and 1-year subscription with automatic renewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code by email
Reviews: Good security software let down by far too many issues.1. The probelm that everyone complains about. That you need to input your card details or you cannot activate the product. There are no words of that kind of behaviour.2. About the system to claim on the Norton guarantee of a refund if they cannot remove a virus. You have to be subscribed to automatic renewal. If you put your card details in to activate Norton, which initiates automatic renewal, then cancel automatic renewal. You can't use the guarantee.3. The app is flaky. When you move your mouse over any of the Norton windows that are open, your mouse lags. It makes using the app, unpleasant.4. If you have your PC on for a few hours the VPN on/off button stops working, forcing you to reboot to gain control.5. I was pleased about the back up data allowance. I figured I might want to back up the odd picture/document. Only to be extremely disappointed. When I went to look at this feature, it required being set-up. At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. I gave up installing add-ons of any kind, because I could not be bothered with the hassle. Very likely I would not have liked how other features operate. There are a few features I am not even trying to use. To a certain extent I gave up exploring other general options too.The VPN is handy if you want to view region restricted content. However using a VPN on a regular basis is somewhat a pain. Wesites load noticabely slower. Some websites are blocked to VPNs, because VPN anonimity is what hackers use. Amazon Priome Video is 50/50 whether it will let you stream with the VPN on. If yu use the VPN day-today, you may have to turn it off to use Amazon Prime Video. ... Whereas other brand/manufacturer VPNs are fine.There are far too many pop-ups in the lower right side of your monitor. I don't mean good advice like 'this file is safe etc'. I mean stuff about do you want to buy a product to stop tracking cookies? Adverts and more than one type. Sometimes you'll get three over short period of time, and be swearing at having to close irritating ad pop-ups. Like what the hell is Norton doing contacting me on my PC desktop experience?
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 February 2024

Name: Norton 360 Deluxe 2024, Antivirus software for 5 Devices and 1-year subscription with automatic renewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code by email
Reviews: I‚Äôve used Norton for several years as it seems an ok product. HOWEVER, Norton as a company continues to engage in some of the most egregious business practices to catch out those who are less tech savvy, so they are potentially, and unwittingly, hit with the full ¬£90 (at time of writing) annual renewal fee or cajoled into paying for additional add-ons.The pros:In my time using Norton my pc has never, as far as I‚Äôm aware, caught a virus.It is easy to open and run a scan.The cons:Where to begin (!). As many reviews state you should always deactivate the auto renewal and buy a new license key at a fraction of the cost. Unfortunately Norton make activating a new key this way as labyrinthine as possible. The online help will tell you to go to a settings page in your current installation of Norton and put in the new key. However, if you have disabled auto renew this method will show an error code that will force you to log in to the main website. Here, to activate your new key Norton will insist that you enter your credit card details and enable auto renew before you then can (& have) to download a new install of the app (that you already have installed on your pc) before it will activate. This also means you will lose any remaining time on your current Norton install as it doesn‚Äôt link the subscriptions.The autorenewal - Since I last installed this Norton appear to have changed the fine print so that if you have deactivated the annual auto-renewal  you also lose access to a number of features including the much vaunted ‚ÄúVirus Protection Promise‚Äù I.e. if your pc does get a virus‚Ä¶you have no recourse to Norton unless you‚Äôve pre-agreed to let them charge you ¬£90 next year, in advance. This makes no sense if you think about it. If you‚Äôre thinking all you‚Äôll do is set a reminder to cancel the auto-renewal a couple of weeks or a month before the renewal date, Norton have also changed the fine print to state that they will take the next payment 35 days in advance (note that time period, as it‚Äôs before you start getting pop-up reminders ).The pop-ups/add-ons - once installed you will be hit with constant pop ups trying to upsell additional features and add-ins. Or pseudo-‚Äúcritical‚Äô notifications in red : ‚ÄúYOU HAVE X BROKEN REGISTRY ENTRIES- FIX NOW?‚Äù That, if clicked will take you to a page asking you to confirm the purchase of said add-on‚Ä¶. And they already have your credit card details from the setup process so, again, I can see how those less technically inclined can have unwitting added ¬£20+ on to their annual subscription without even realising. You can turn these pop ups off but in reality they just seem to ‚Äòsnooze‚Äô eventually coming back after a few days.In summary, yes, the core product seems to work well enough but the fact I have to put so much active effort in to avoiding being ripped off, or inadvertently charged additional costs makes me question Norton‚Äôs ethics and integrity as a company. Ultimately this will be the last time I  use them as there are alternatives out there, and it‚Äôs at the point now where it‚Äôs easier to go with a different product each year than trying to navigate Nortons renewal process.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 August 2023

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024, 1 Device | Antivirus, VPN, Password Manager, Mobile and Internet Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|1 Year Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I have been using this product for a few years and I always buy from Amazon due to price (the auto-renewal from McAfee is much more - although I do note they have a special offer on this year at 2 years for ¬£27 ish per year which is pretty good).It installs easy on PC (windows) and on my android phone, but iPad is a real pain.  What is not explained, (and I am thankful to another reviewer for the hint) is that, is that it will not work on an iPad unless you use the Chrome browser. Most things default to safari so you need to be clear about how you do it!The other thing which is also not mentioned in any instructions is the app on iPad is not "Total Protection" - it offers "Mcafee Security: VPN & Privacy".  But after you (finally ......!) complete the install and 'sync account', you will see it counts as one of your 10 licenses against "Total Protection".The other thing I noted is that the VPN product, while worth having if you spend lots of time in coffee shops on strange wifi, is limited to 500mb while using the VPN so it's really a trial - and that is not advertised, Amazon need to grip that.  500mb is not going to last very long at all.The protection it gives is really good, but I feel the issues I mention above need addressing by both McAfee and Amazon and thus why it lost a star

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024, 1 Device | Antivirus, VPN, Password Manager, Mobile and Internet Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|1 Year Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I used to work for Mcafee many years ago in a technical role. As such I trusted their anti-virus protection and have kept it ever since. It's something I often regret as it's horribly flawed.  Not least their bullying attempt to get you to turn on auto-renew. [Never do that!]  They will rip you off.  Instead I learnt to buy my yearly subscription from Amazon for a fraction of the price [Good work Amazon!]. It requires jumping through many hoops, but the savings make it worthwhile as it's only once a year.  That said, whilst the protection they offer feels reassuring it's negated by the total harassment of the pop up notifications that can't be turned off, no matter what.  Most annoying - for me - is the pop up that constantly appears 3 months [3 MONTHS!] before your subscription lapses. It attempts to scare you into submission and force you down the more expensive path. It strikes me as a dreadful business model; but having worked for them doesn't surprise.  The senior management in my time were complete clenching sphincters, full of male toxicity. It appears nothing has changed on that front.  The only reason I continue with this poor service is the free VPN, which is occasionally useful.  Choose McAfee - if like me - you are prepared to fight crappy systems.  They still remain better than Norton in every sector [those guys are just rubbish].  I hope on many levels someone that counts reads this review as it's my true and honest testimony.  I'd also add that Windows Defender is very good and you probably don't need extra protection, but I'm a 'Belt and Braces' kinda guy.

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024, 1 Device | Antivirus, VPN, Password Manager, Mobile and Internet Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|1 Year Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I already had McAfee Total Protection and the annual subscription was up for renewal. Having been stung by McAfee's expensive automatic renewal process in the past I had turned off the auto renew function so I could do it manually.If I had renewed directly through McAfee, they wanted US$169 as their default was to upgrade to something I didn't need. I could have switched to a lower package for US$69 or bought the full Total Protection package download direct from McAfee for ¬£69.I opted instead to get the very same Total Protection 2019 download from Amazon for just under ¬£21 which covers up to 10 devices (other options are available for 1, 3 or 5 devices). This is the exact same product that I was already using which simplifies the process. (It automatically updates to the latest version so I started 2 years ago with the 2017 version which has updated a few times). It's a digital download and Amazon sent an activation code by e-mail within 2 minutes.I was half expecting to have to remove and re-download the software on all my devices as payback for being too tight to pay the auto renewal fee but thankfully that was not the case. I just followed the instructions to activate the code using my existing McAfee account and it immediately updated the subscription across all registered devices. Really quick and simple.They tell you it can take a day or two for the new expiry date to appear on all devices but you can refresh it manually, which I did, and it all worked perfectly.One thing to remember though is when you renew the subscription, it re-sets the renewal option to automatic for next time and McAfee process the auto renewal a month or two early just to catch you out. If you want to avoid that happening you need to go into settings to switch off the auto renewal function every time you renew. There's no way you can forget about it because you get reminders popping up every day from about 2 months before renewal date.Yes McAfee have some questionable business practices but the product works and keeps my devices secure.

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024, 1 Device | Antivirus, VPN, Password Manager, Mobile and Internet Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|1 Year Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I got this to upgrade & renew my Total Protection 2019 which I got via Amazon this time last year. Complete installation from scratch last year was trouble-free and I've been impressed by the software over the last 12 months, so that, and the Amazon price this time, made renewal a no-brainer. The renewal process was remarkably straightforward. The Amazon email arrived immediately with the renewal code, and I followed the email instructions to go to the McAfee activate page. When I put in the renewal code and my email address, McAfee detected that I already had an account / licences with them, asked me to sign in (which I did) and then asked my to confirm that I wanted to apply the renewal to the 2019 Total Protection (rather than an older McAfee product on a now defunct computer). When I confirmed this, McAfee extended the TP licence expiry to the 2021 anniversary of the 2019 version, so I'll have the 2020 version for about 10 days more than the straight 365. And because I was just renewing TP, there was no need to remove old licences / versions and install TP from scratch. The whole process from signing into Amazon to buy through to signing out of McAfee and starting my first 2020 AV scan (just as a precaution) took less than 10 minutes. I'm very impressed. The AV software runs fine, the Amazon price is amazing, and I'm very happy to recommend both companies.

Name: Norton 360 Deluxe 2024, Antivirus Software for 3 Devices and 1-Year Subscription with Automatic ‚ÄéRenewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code by email
Reviews: Good security software let down by far too many issues.1. The probelm that everyone complains about. That you need to input your card details or you cannot activate the product. There are no words of that kind of behaviour.2. About the system to claim on the Norton guarantee of a refund if they cannot remove a virus. You have to be subscribed to automatic renewal. If you put your card details in to activate Norton, which initiates automatic renewal, then cancel automatic renewal. You can't use the guarantee.3. The app is flaky. When you move your mouse over any of the Norton windows that are open, your mouse lags. It makes using the app, unpleasant.4. If you have your PC on for a few hours the VPN on/off button stops working, forcing you to reboot to gain control.5. I was pleased about the back up data allowance. I figured I might want to back up the odd picture/document. Only to be extremely disappointed. When I went to look at this feature, it required being set-up. At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. I gave up installing add-ons of any kind, because I could not be bothered with the hassle. Very likely I would not have liked how other features operate. There are a few features I am not even trying to use. To a certain extent I gave up exploring other general options too.The VPN is handy if you want to view region restricted content. However using a VPN on a regular basis is somewhat a pain. Wesites load noticabely slower. Some websites are blocked to VPNs, because VPN anonimity is what hackers use. Amazon Priome Video is 50/50 whether it will let you stream with the VPN on. If yu use the VPN day-today, you may have to turn it off to use Amazon Prime Video. ... Whereas other brand/manufacturer VPNs are fine.There are far too many pop-ups in the lower right side of your monitor. I don't mean good advice like 'this file is safe etc'. I mean stuff about do you want to buy a product to stop tracking cookies? Adverts and more than one type. Sometimes you'll get three over short period of time, and be swearing at having to close irritating ad pop-ups. Like what the hell is Norton doing contacting me on my PC desktop experience?

Name: Norton 360 Deluxe 2024, Antivirus Software for 3 Devices and 1-Year Subscription with Automatic ‚ÄéRenewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code by email
Reviews: I‚Äôve used Norton for several years as it seems an ok product. HOWEVER, Norton as a company continues to engage in some of the most egregious business practices to catch out those who are less tech savvy, so they are potentially, and unwittingly, hit with the full ¬£90 (at time of writing) annual renewal fee or cajoled into paying for additional add-ons.The pros:In my time using Norton my pc has never, as far as I‚Äôm aware, caught a virus.It is easy to open and run a scan.The cons:Where to begin (!). As many reviews state you should always deactivate the auto renewal and buy a new license key at a fraction of the cost. Unfortunately Norton make activating a new key this way as labyrinthine as possible. The online help will tell you to go to a settings page in your current installation of Norton and put in the new key. However, if you have disabled auto renew this method will show an error code that will force you to log in to the main website. Here, to activate your new key Norton will insist that you enter your credit card details and enable auto renew before you then can (& have) to download a new install of the app (that you already have installed on your pc) before it will activate. This also means you will lose any remaining time on your current Norton install as it doesn‚Äôt link the subscriptions.The autorenewal - Since I last installed this Norton appear to have changed the fine print so that if you have deactivated the annual auto-renewal  you also lose access to a number of features including the much vaunted ‚ÄúVirus Protection Promise‚Äù I.e. if your pc does get a virus‚Ä¶you have no recourse to Norton unless you‚Äôve pre-agreed to let them charge you ¬£90 next year, in advance. This makes no sense if you think about it. If you‚Äôre thinking all you‚Äôll do is set a reminder to cancel the auto-renewal a couple of weeks or a month before the renewal date, Norton have also changed the fine print to state that they will take the next payment 35 days in advance (note that time period, as it‚Äôs before you start getting pop-up reminders ).The pop-ups/add-ons - once installed you will be hit with constant pop ups trying to upsell additional features and add-ins. Or pseudo-‚Äúcritical‚Äô notifications in red : ‚ÄúYOU HAVE X BROKEN REGISTRY ENTRIES- FIX NOW?‚Äù That, if clicked will take you to a page asking you to confirm the purchase of said add-on‚Ä¶. And they already have your credit card details from the setup process so, again, I can see how those less technically inclined can have unwitting added ¬£20+ on to their annual subscription without even realising. You can turn these pop ups off but in reality they just seem to ‚Äòsnooze‚Äô eventually coming back after a few days.In summary, yes, the core product seems to work well enough but the fact I have to put so much active effort in to avoiding being ripped off, or inadvertently charged additional costs makes me question Norton‚Äôs ethics and integrity as a company. Ultimately this will be the last time I  use them as there are alternatives out there, and it‚Äôs at the point now where it‚Äôs easier to go with a different product each year than trying to navigate Nortons renewal process.

Name: Norton 360 Deluxe 2024, Antivirus Software for 3 Devices and 1-Year Subscription with Automatic ‚ÄéRenewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code by email
Reviews: Good security software let down by far too many issues.1. The probelm that everyone complains about. That you need to input your card details or you cannot activate the product. There are no words of that kind of behaviour.2. About the system to claim on the Norton guarantee of a refund if they cannot remove a virus. You have to be subscribed to automatic renewal. If you put your card details in to activate Norton, which initiates automatic renewal, then cancel automatic renewal. You can't use the guarantee.3. The app is flaky. When you move your mouse over any of the Norton windows that are open, your mouse lags. It makes using the app, unpleasant.4. If you have your PC on for a few hours the VPN on/off button stops working, forcing you to reboot to gain control.5. I was pleased about the back up data allowance. I figured I might want to back up the odd picture/document. Only to be extremely disappointed. When I went to look at this feature, it required being set-up. At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. I gave up installing add-ons of any kind, because I could not be bothered with the hassle. Very likely I would not have liked how other features operate. There are a few features I am not even trying to use. To a certain extent I gave up exploring other general options too.The VPN is handy if you want to view region restricted content. However using a VPN on a regular basis is somewhat a pain. Wesites load noticabely slower. Some websites are blocked to VPNs, because VPN anonimity is what hackers use. Amazon Priome Video is 50/50 whether it will let you stream with the VPN on. If yu use the VPN day-today, you may have to turn it off to use Amazon Prime Video. ... Whereas other brand/manufacturer VPNs are fine.There are far too many pop-ups in the lower right side of your monitor. I don't mean good advice like 'this file is safe etc'. I mean stuff about do you want to buy a product to stop tracking cookies? Adverts and more than one type. Sometimes you'll get three over short period of time, and be swearing at having to close irritating ad pop-ups. Like what the hell is Norton doing contacting me on my PC desktop experience?

At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. Name: Norton 360 Deluxe 2024, Antivirus Software for 3 Devices and 1-Year Subscription with Automatic ‚ÄéRenewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code by email
Reviews: I‚Äôve used Norton for several years as it seems an ok product. HOWEVER, Norton as a company continues to engage in some of the most egregious business practices to catch out those who are less tech savvy, so they are potentially, and unwittingly, hit with the full ¬£90 (at time of writing) annual renewal fee or cajoled into paying for additional add-ons.The pros:In my time using Norton my pc has never, as far as I‚Äôm aware, caught a virus.It is easy to open and run a scan.The cons:Where to begin (!). As many reviews state you should always deactivate the auto renewal and buy a new license key at a fraction of the cost. Unfortunately Norton make activating a new key this way as labyrinthine as possible. The online help will tell you to go to a settings page in your current installation of Norton and put in the new key. However, if you have disabled auto renew this method will show an error code that will force you to log in to the main website. Here, to activate your new key Norton will insist that you enter your credit card details and enable auto renew before you then can (& have) to download a new install of the app (that you already have installed on your pc) before it will activate. This also means you will lose any remaining time on your current Norton install as it doesn‚Äôt link the subscriptions.The autorenewal - Since I last installed this Norton appear to have changed the fine print so that if you have deactivated the annual auto-renewal  you also lose access to a number of features including the much vaunted ‚ÄúVirus Protection Promise‚Äù I.e. if your pc does get a virus‚Ä¶you have no recourse to Norton unless you‚Äôve pre-agreed to let them charge you ¬£90 next year, in advance. This makes no sense if you think about it. If you‚Äôre thinking all you‚Äôll do is set a reminder to cancel the auto-renewal a couple of weeks or a month before the renewal date, Norton have also changed the fine print to state that they will take the next payment 35 days in advance (note that time period, as it‚Äôs before you start getting pop-up reminders ).The pop-ups/add-ons - once installed you will be hit with constant pop ups trying to upsell additional features and add-ins. Or pseudo-‚Äúcritical‚Äô notifications in red : ‚ÄúYOU HAVE X BROKEN REGISTRY ENTRIES- FIX NOW?‚Äù That, if clicked will take you to a page asking you to confirm the purchase of said add-on‚Ä¶. And they already have your credit card details from the setup process so, again, I can see how those less technically inclined can have unwitting added ¬£20+ on to their annual subscription without even realising. You can turn these pop ups off but in reality they just seem to ‚Äòsnooze‚Äô eventually coming back after a few days.In summary, yes, the core product seems to work well enough but the fact I have to put so much active effort in to avoiding being ripped off, or inadvertently charged additional costs makes me question Norton‚Äôs ethics and integrity as a company. Ultimately this will be the last time I  use them as there are alternatives out there, and it‚Äôs at the point now where it‚Äôs easier to go with a different product each year than trying to navigate Nortons renewal process.

Reviews: Kaspersky total security is my favourite of the all in one security packages and this is my 4th year using it. Always uninstall and buy digitally from amazon - it‚Äôs about 1/3 the price of renewing.Not much has changed this year - same great product with a slightly (very slightly) updated user interface. New this year so far seems to be an improved software updater that‚Äôs a nice touch.Reason I use this is that It regularly scores highest on malware tests, and as a bonus comes with actually useful tools like webcam blocker, the update checker, privacy and security optimisation browser plug-ins and such, and is very light on system resources - I don‚Äôt need to turn it off to game for example. I‚Äôve bought a couple of computers that have come with trials of norton or trend micro and the just feel sub par by comparison.Minus 1 star from a perfect 5 for continuing to bundle kaspersky‚Äôs overpriced VPN software trial, and dumb region locking. The VPN can be removed post install by searching ‚Äòadd or remove programs‚Äô, but the region locking seemed particularly lazy.I didn‚Äôt notice when I bought this that it was UK only - that‚Äôs my bad, it says right on the page - but kaspersky‚Äôs enforcement is very lazy. I‚Äôm currently in Australia, but bought from the UK as my kaspersky account and payment card are still UK-based. Name: Kaspersky Premium Total Security 2024 | 3 Devices | 1 Year | Anti-Phishing and Firewall | Unlimited VPN | Password Manager | Parental Controls | 24/7 Support | PC/Mac/Mobile | UK Online Code
Reviews: Kaspersky total security is my favourite of the all in one security packages and this is my 4th year using it. Always uninstall and buy digitally from amazon - it‚Äôs about 1/3 the price of renewing.Not much has changed this year - same great product with a slightly (very slightly) updated user interface. New this year so far seems to be an improved software updater that‚Äôs a nice touch.Reason I use this is that It regularly scores highest on malware tests, and as a bonus comes with actually useful tools like webcam blocker, the update checker, privacy and security optimisation browser plug-ins and such, and is very light on system resources - I don‚Äôt need to turn it off to game for example. I‚Äôve bought a couple of computers that have come with trials of norton or trend micro and the just feel sub par by comparison.Minus 1 star from a perfect 5 for continuing to bundle kaspersky‚Äôs overpriced VPN software trial, and dumb region locking. The VPN can be removed post install by searching ‚Äòadd or remove programs‚Äô, but the region locking seemed particularly lazy.I didn‚Äôt notice when I bought this that it was UK only - that‚Äôs my bad, it says right on the page - but kaspersky‚Äôs enforcement is very lazy. I‚Äôm currently in Australia, but bought from the UK as my kaspersky account and payment card are still UK-based. It let me activate that serial fine (so no refund possibility) but then wouldn‚Äôt activate the software once downloaded even though the last one worked fine until the day before lol. They know my account, my history, my hardware, etc. it should work better. However all good as activated fine when using a VPN and no problems since with the VPN turned off.

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024, 3 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Password Manager, Mobile and Internet Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|1 Year Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I bought this product and it and from start to finish I have had problems. After I downloaded it, I ran a scan, but my laptop kept restarting after it was only 50% (approx) through the scan. I got in touch with McAfee and at the beginning they were very helpful.They asked if they could remotely take control of my laptop so they could identify the issue. I agreed. The operator was doing something with my windows (think trying to update it) but then the laptop done an automatic restart (we were disconnected).I got in touch with the operator again and informed them that we had been disconnected due to my laptop restart. They once again took remote control and again it done a restart disconnecting us!I again got in touch, but it took me ages to get through to someone on their helpline. They kept sending me emails saying that my Service Request  number would be closed if I didn't get in touch. I have tried and tried but to no avail!!The customer care has been really really poor and I now have a laptop now that just continues to restart all the time (not even when I conduct a scan) and I cant even switched it on. My laptop is now completely useless!!I would strongly advice against buying this product for 2 reasons:1. The scan wouldn't run and ended up damaging my laptop (if you have downloaded this product please try and run a scan).2. The customer care has been woeful and extremely difficult to get in touch with almost impossible.Please stay away from this product!
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2024

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024, 3 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Password Manager, Mobile and Internet Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|1 Year Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I bought this product and it and from start to finish I have had problems. After I downloaded it, I ran a scan, but my laptop kept restarting after it was only 50% (approx) through the scan. I got in touch with McAfee and at the beginning they were very helpful.They asked if they could remotely take control of my laptop so they could identify the issue. I agreed. The operator was doing something with my windows (think trying to update it) but then the laptop done an automatic restart (we were disconnected).I got in touch with the operator again and informed them that we had been disconnected due to my laptop restart. They once again took remote control and again it done a restart disconnecting us!I again got in touch, but it took me ages to get through to someone on their helpline. They kept sending me emails saying that my Service Request  number would be closed if I didn't get in touch. I have tried and tried but to no avail!!The customer care has been really really poor and I now have a laptop now that just continues to restart all the time (not even when I conduct a scan) and I cant even switched it on. My laptop is now completely useless!!I would strongly advice against buying this product for 2 reasons:1. The scan wouldn't run and ended up damaging my laptop (if you have downloaded this product please try and run a scan).2. The customer care has been woeful and extremely difficult to get in touch with almost impossible.Please stay away from this product!
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2024

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I have used McAfee for some years now... After trying various other brands, this for me is by far the simplest to use... Not too many interruptions like some do... Prompts etc... Just install and away you go.  Always remember to uninstall any existing virus software to save midday stopping advising you to do Just that.Although I have used this for years, this is the first time of buying via Amazon and after comparing prices elsewhere, the prices are very much the same (other then directly from company which is way much higher!).  If the pricing stays competitive, I will certainly buy next time.The software itself is do easy to install... From buying to installing it is a matter of a few clicks on the computer... No waiting around for the post to arrive or an email with an attachment etc... Straightforward from the off.I have never had any issues with viruses etc whilst using McAfee and use my computer worry free.Definitely recommend and a great, but realistic price point too!
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 June 2023

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: This security product seems very good especially the price. It is affordable and gives total protection of 5 devices, its now covering my 2 mobile phones and a laptop as well as my wife's mobile phones.It guards devices against all forms of threats. It is recommended especially in these times we're facing cyber security issues.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 February 2024

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: The software is one of those 'install and forget' progs. Easy to navigate the menu. However, it has one quite annoying feature I have to put up with, every time when you use VPN it turns your own default searching engine (Google, in my case) into MA's own 'safety search' sponsored by Yahoo. You can manually switch it off in the browser settings, but doing it every time you use VPN ( and I use it frequently) is a pain in the neck. Apart from that it's a good safe piece of software.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 November 2023

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: Great price over BitDfndr renewal, which I had been using for many years. No complaints after 2 months of running in on multiple machines.  BD had more features such as PC Optimisation,  which are paid add on for McAfee. However, so far never had AV hogging 100% cpu, which was rather common in BD. This certainly is a better /smarter AV imo.This version of McAfee also has unlimited VPN as standard as opposed to megerly 200mb daily limit on BD per device.Overall, excellent

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I have used McAfee for some years now... After trying various other brands, this for me is by far the simplest to use... Not too many interruptions like some do... Prompts etc... Just install and away you go.  Always remember to uninstall any existing virus software to save midday stopping advising you to do Just that.Although I have used this for years, this is the first time of buying via Amazon and after comparing prices elsewhere, the prices are very much the same (other then directly from company which is way much higher!).  If the pricing stays competitive, I will certainly buy next time.The software itself is do easy to install... From buying to installing it is a matter of a few clicks on the computer... No waiting around for the post to arrive or an email with an attachment etc... Straightforward from the off.I have never had any issues with viruses etc whilst using McAfee and use my computer worry free.Definitely recommend and a great, but realistic price point too!

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: The software is one of those 'install and forget' progs. Easy to navigate the menu. However, it has one quite annoying feature I have to put up with, every time when you use VPN it turns your own default searching engine (Google, in my case) into MA's own 'safety search' sponsored by Yahoo. You can manually switch it off in the browser settings, but doing it every time you use VPN ( and I use it frequently) is a pain in the neck. Apart from that it's a good safe piece of software.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 November 2023

Name: McAfee Total Protection 2024 Amazon Exclusive, 10 Devices | Antivirus, VPN, Parental Controls, Password Manager, Mobile Security | PC/Mac/iOS/Android|15 Month Subscription | Activation Code by email
Reviews: Great price over BitDfndr renewal, which I had been using for many years. No complaints after 2 months of running in on multiple machines.  BD had more features such as PC Optimisation,  which are paid add on for McAfee. However, so far never had AV hogging 100% cpu, which was rather common in BD. This certainly is a better /smarter AV imo.This version of McAfee also has unlimited VPN as standard as opposed to megerly 200mb daily limit on BD per device.Overall, excellent

Name: Bitdefender Total Security 2024 - 10 Device | 1 year Subscription | PC/Mac | Activation Code by Post
Reviews: I have used Bitdefender for many years with its low impact on my system hardware speed but a high level of protection. If you switch on all of the protection, it even protects against ransomware which has been very high profile in the news lately. The installation process is painless and this version can protect 10 devices that include smartphones and tablets.  Amazon is cheaper than buying from Bitdefender directly, something their sales desk admits.  All of the PC test reviews I have looked at agree that its detection rates and more importantly what it does when it finds something, is the best of the best and it has saved me from problems many times when surfing the net. Sometimes this is because website designers have not been too careful about how they have assembled their sites. A well-known UK supermarket always flashes up warnings genuinely but I am protected against those bad elements in real-time by Bitdefender so I can still get my order done in safely. This is one purchase you will not regret.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 January 2023

Name: Bitdefender Total Security 2024 - 10 Device | 1 year Subscription | PC/Mac | Activation Code by Post
Reviews: I have used this product for years. I have twice renewed here - BitDefender via Amazon and snail mail - because BitDefender quote 50% more to renew by email and cover only 5 instead of 10 devices!If you have a subscription, you can just add the activation code received by post and the subscription is extended from its end date. That is, no days are lost. Do not start a new subscription if you already have one!

Reviews: Bitdefender Total Security is a cross-platform antivirus software that offers protection for Windows, Mac OS, iOS, and Android devices. It has a range of features to keep your digital life safe from hackers, malware, ransomware, phishing, fraud, spam, and more. Name: Bitdefender Total Security 2024 - 10 Device | 1 year Subscription | PC/Mac | Activation Code by Post
Reviews: I never thought I would ever say that a program like Bitdefender could be annoying.  I had a paid version of Kaspersky prior to bitdefender and that wasn't as annoying.  Bitdefender continually sends notifications asking me to turn on the VPN, I get that they want to make more money but I already have surfshark so I ain't interested and I cannot find a way to switch them off.  Secondly the other day I get a notification telling me my phone was at risk, I go into bitdefender to run a scan after seeing another message saying we are aware of malware on your device.  So I run a scan after which I get the message your device was clean no malware found, but why don't you switch on our VPN... It's a bit like a cheap Chinese knock-off program, fairly regularly I get notifications about the VPN thing or some other stuff to try to get me to pay for paid add ons to the software.Another annoying thing is that I am being asked to turn on scam alert so I pressed the button to turn it on and I'm informed that I need to authorise something in settings.  There's a button which I need to click on and that supposedly will take me to the area in settings where I need to be be, I do this and I am brought back to the original page which is telling me that scam alert needs to be turned on.  This seems to be a never-ending circle as it never gets me into settings.  I report it and they want screenshot after screenshot after screenshot... That's a whole story in itself!I want a security program to run in the background to not be intrusive unless there is a definite attack on my phone or my PC and to be able to switch certain areas on or off without going round and round in circles.I don't want it popping up all the time like a delboy salesman try to sell me something that I don't need or want.  Enough said!
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 December 2021

Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email
Reviews: Good security software let down by far too many issues.1. The probelm that everyone complains about. That you need to input your card details or you cannot activate the product. There are no words of that kind of behaviour.2. About the system to claim on the Norton guarantee of a refund if they cannot remove a virus. You have to be subscribed to automatic renewal. If you put your card details in to activate Norton, which initiates automatic renewal, then cancel automatic renewal. You can't use the guarantee.3. The app is flaky. When you move your mouse over any of the Norton windows that are open, your mouse lags. It makes using the app, unpleasant.4. If you have your PC on for a few hours the VPN on/off button stops working, forcing you to reboot to gain control.5. I was pleased about the back up data allowance. I figured I might want to back up the odd picture/document. Only to be extremely disappointed. When I went to look at this feature, it required being set-up. At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. I gave up installing add-ons of any kind, because I could not be bothered with the hassle. Very likely I would not have liked how other features operate. There are a few features I am not even trying to use. To a certain extent I gave up exploring other general options too.The VPN is handy if you want to view region restricted content. However using a VPN on a regular basis is somewhat a pain. Wesites load noticabely slower. Some websites are blocked to VPNs, because VPN anonimity is what hackers use. Amazon Priome Video is 50/50 whether it will let you stream with the VPN on. If yu use the VPN day-today, you may have to turn it off to use Amazon Prime Video. ... Whereas other brand/manufacturer VPNs are fine.There are far too many pop-ups in the lower right side of your monitor. I don't mean good advice like 'this file is safe etc'. I mean stuff about do you want to buy a product to stop tracking cookies? Adverts and more than one type. Sometimes you'll get three over short period of time, and be swearing at having to close irritating ad pop-ups. Like what the hell is Norton doing contacting me on my PC desktop experience?
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 February 2024

Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I‚Äôve used Norton for several years as it seems an ok product. HOWEVER, Norton as a company continues to engage in some of the most egregious business practices to catch out those who are less tech savvy, so they are potentially, and unwittingly, hit with the full ¬£90 (at time of writing) annual renewal fee or cajoled into paying for additional add-ons.The pros:In my time using Norton my pc has never, as far as I‚Äôm aware, caught a virus.It is easy to open and run a scan.The cons:Where to begin (!). As many reviews state you should always deactivate the auto renewal and buy a new license key at a fraction of the cost. Unfortunately Norton make activating a new key this way as labyrinthine as possible. The online help will tell you to go to a settings page in your current installation of Norton and put in the new key. However, if you have disabled auto renew this method will show an error code that will force you to log in to the main website. Here, to activate your new key Norton will insist that you enter your credit card details and enable auto renew before you then can (& have) to download a new install of the app (that you already have installed on your pc) before it will activate. This also means you will lose any remaining time on your current Norton install as it doesn‚Äôt link the subscriptions.The autorenewal - Since I last installed this Norton appear to have changed the fine print so that if you have deactivated the annual auto-renewal  you also lose access to a number of features including the much vaunted ‚ÄúVirus Protection Promise‚Äù I.e. if your pc does get a virus‚Ä¶you have no recourse to Norton unless you‚Äôve pre-agreed to let them charge you ¬£90 next year, in advance. This makes no sense if you think about it. If you‚Äôre thinking all you‚Äôll do is set a reminder to cancel the auto-renewal a couple of weeks or a month before the renewal date, Norton have also changed the fine print to state that they will take the next payment 35 days in advance (note that time period, as it‚Äôs before you start getting pop-up reminders ).The pop-ups/add-ons - once installed you will be hit with constant pop ups trying to upsell additional features and add-ins. Or pseudo-‚Äúcritical‚Äô notifications in red : ‚ÄúYOU HAVE X BROKEN REGISTRY ENTRIES- FIX NOW?‚Äù That, if clicked will take you to a page asking you to confirm the purchase of said add-on‚Ä¶. And they already have your credit card details from the setup process so, again, I can see how those less technically inclined can have unwitting added ¬£20+ on to their annual subscription without even realising. You can turn these pop ups off but in reality they just seem to ‚Äòsnooze‚Äô eventually coming back after a few days.In summary, yes, the core product seems to work well enough but the fact I have to put so much active effort in to avoiding being ripped off, or inadvertently charged additional costs makes me question Norton‚Äôs ethics and integrity as a company. Ultimately this will be the last time I  use them as there are alternatives out there, and it‚Äôs at the point now where it‚Äôs easier to go with a different product each year than trying to navigate Nortons renewal process.

Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I have been using Norton for many years and, overall, I am very pleased with it. However, what really annoys me is the cost for auto renewal. In round numbers (I hate messing around with all these 99p) renewal was going to cost me ¬£90.  When  I hadn‚Äôt renewed within a couple of weeks of the expiry date Norton sent a special offer of just ¬£30. However, I then realised I could buy the product again at just ¬£13. It did take slightly longer to install but the saving was worth the time.I immediately turned off auto renew on the newly purchased product. Two months later I received an email saying that if I switched on auto renew I would get an extra 3 months of cover. This I have done and made a note to switch it off again just before the renewal date. Then the whole cycle starts again.To summarise I could have renewed for 12 months for ¬£90. Instead I have purchased new cover for 15months for ¬£13.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 January 2024

Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email
Reviews: Good security software let down by far too many issues.1. The probelm that everyone complains about. That you need to input your card details or you cannot activate the product. There are no words of that kind of behaviour.2. About the system to claim on the Norton guarantee of a refund if they cannot remove a virus. You have to be subscribed to automatic renewal. If you put your card details in to activate Norton, which initiates automatic renewal, then cancel automatic renewal. You can't use the guarantee.3. The app is flaky. When you move your mouse over any of the Norton windows that are open, your mouse lags. It makes using the app, unpleasant.4. If you have your PC on for a few hours the VPN on/off button stops working, forcing you to reboot to gain control.5. I was pleased about the back up data allowance. I figured I might want to back up the odd picture/document. Only to be extremely disappointed. When I went to look at this feature, it required being set-up. At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. I gave up installing add-ons of any kind, because I could not be bothered with the hassle. Very likely I would not have liked how other features operate. There are a few features I am not even trying to use. To a certain extent I gave up exploring other general options too.The VPN is handy if you want to view region restricted content. However using a VPN on a regular basis is somewhat a pain. Wesites load noticabely slower. Some websites are blocked to VPNs, because VPN anonimity is what hackers use. Amazon Priome Video is 50/50 whether it will let you stream with the VPN on. If yu use the VPN day-today, you may have to turn it off to use Amazon Prime Video. ... Whereas other brand/manufacturer VPNs are fine.There are far too many pop-ups in the lower right side of your monitor. I don't mean good advice like 'this file is safe etc'. I mean stuff about do you want to buy a product to stop tracking cookies? Adverts and more than one type. Sometimes you'll get three over short period of time, and be swearing at having to close irritating ad pop-ups. Like what the hell is Norton doing contacting me on my PC desktop experience?
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 February 2024

Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email
Reviews: I‚Äôve used Norton for several years as it seems an ok product. HOWEVER, Norton as a company continues to engage in some of the most egregious business practices to catch out those who are less tech savvy, so they are potentially, and unwittingly, hit with the full ¬£90 (at time of writing) annual renewal fee or cajoled into paying for additional add-ons.The pros:In my time using Norton my pc has never, as far as I‚Äôm aware, caught a virus.It is easy to open and run a scan.The cons:Where to begin (!). As many reviews state you should always deactivate the auto renewal and buy a new license key at a fraction of the cost. Unfortunately Norton make activating a new key this way as labyrinthine as possible. The online help will tell you to go to a settings page in your current installation of Norton and put in the new key. However, if you have disabled auto renew this method will show an error code that will force you to log in to the main website. Here, to activate your new key Norton will insist that you enter your credit card details and enable auto renew before you then can (& have) to download a new install of the app (that you already have installed on your pc) before it will activate. This also means you will lose any remaining time on your current Norton install as it doesn‚Äôt link the subscriptions.The autorenewal - Since I last installed this Norton appear to have changed the fine print so that if you have deactivated the annual auto-renewal  you also lose access to a number of features including the much vaunted ‚ÄúVirus Protection Promise‚Äù I.e. if your pc does get a virus‚Ä¶you have no recourse to Norton unless you‚Äôve pre-agreed to let them charge you ¬£90 next year, in advance. This makes no sense if you think about it. If you‚Äôre thinking all you‚Äôll do is set a reminder to cancel the auto-renewal a couple of weeks or a month before the renewal date, Norton have also changed the fine print to state that they will take the next payment 35 days in advance (note that time period, as it‚Äôs before you start getting pop-up reminders ).The pop-ups/add-ons - once installed you will be hit with constant pop ups trying to upsell additional features and add-ins. Or pseudo-‚Äúcritical‚Äô notifications in red : ‚ÄúYOU HAVE X BROKEN REGISTRY ENTRIES- FIX NOW?‚Äù That, if clicked will take you to a page asking you to confirm the purchase of said add-on‚Ä¶. And they already have your credit card details from the setup process so, again, I can see how those less technically inclined can have unwitting added ¬£20+ on to their annual subscription without even realising. You can turn these pop ups off but in reality they just seem to ‚Äòsnooze‚Äô eventually coming back after a few days.In summary, yes, the core product seems to work well enough but the fact I have to put so much active effort in to avoiding being ripped off, or inadvertently charged additional costs makes me question Norton‚Äôs ethics and integrity as a company. Ultimately this will be the last time I  use them as there are alternatives out there, and it‚Äôs at the point now where it‚Äôs easier to go with a different product each year than trying to navigate Nortons renewal process.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 August 2023

Here, to activate your new key Norton will insist that you enter your credit card details and enable auto renew before you then can (& have) to download a new install of the app (that you already have installed on your pc) before it will activate. This also means you will lose any remaining time on your current Norton install as it doesn‚Äôt link the subscriptions.The autorenewal - Since I last installed this Norton appear to have changed the fine print so that if you have deactivated the annual auto-renewal  you also lose access to a number of features including the much vaunted ‚ÄúVirus Protection Promise‚Äù I.e. if your pc does get a virus‚Ä¶you have no recourse to Norton unless you‚Äôve pre-agreed to let them charge you ¬£90 next year, in advance. This makes no sense if you think about it. If you‚Äôre thinking all you‚Äôll do is set a reminder to cancel the auto-renewal a couple of weeks or a month before the renewal date, Norton have also changed the fine print to state that they will take the next payment 35 days in advance (note that time period, as it‚Äôs before you start getting pop-up reminders ).The pop-ups/add-ons - once installed you will be hit with constant pop ups trying to upsell additional features and add-ins. Or pseudo-‚Äúcritical‚Äô notifications in red : ‚ÄúYOU HAVE X BROKEN REGISTRY ENTRIES- FIX NOW?‚Äù That, if clicked will take you to a page asking you to confirm the purchase of said add-on‚Ä¶. And they already have your credit card details from the setup process so, again, I can see how those less technically inclined can have unwitting added ¬£20+ on to their annual subscription without even realising. You can turn these pop ups off but in reality they just seem to ‚Äòsnooze‚Äô eventually coming back after a few days.In summary, yes, the core product seems to work well enough but the fact I have to put so much active effort in to avoiding being ripped off, or inadvertently charged additional costs makes me question Norton‚Äôs ethics and integrity as a company. Ultimately this will be the last time I  use them as there are alternatives out there, and it‚Äôs at the point now where it‚Äôs easier to go with a different product each year than trying to navigate Nortons renewal process.

Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email

It did take slightly longer to install but the saving was worth the time.I immediately turned off auto renew on the newly purchased product. Two months later I received an email saying that if I switched on auto renew I would get an extra 3 months of cover. This I have done and made a note to switch it off again just before the renewal date. Then the whole cycle starts again.To summarise I could have renewed for 12 months for ¬£90. Name: Norton 360 Premium + Utilities 2024 - Antivirus & Utility | 10 Devices | 1-year subscription | Automatic renewal, Secure VPN , Password Manager | 1 Device | PC/Mac/Mobile | Activation Code by email
Reviews: Good security software let down by far too many issues.1. The probelm that everyone complains about. That you need to input your card details or you cannot activate the product. There are no words of that kind of behaviour.2. About the system to claim on the Norton guarantee of a refund if they cannot remove a virus. You have to be subscribed to automatic renewal. If you put your card details in to activate Norton, which initiates automatic renewal, then cancel automatic renewal. You can't use the guarantee.3. The app is flaky. When you move your mouse over any of the Norton windows that are open, your mouse lags. It makes using the app, unpleasant.4. If you have your PC on for a few hours the VPN on/off button stops working, forcing you to reboot to gain control.5. I was pleased about the back up data allowance. I figured I might want to back up the odd picture/document. Only to be extremely disappointed. When I went to look at this feature, it required being set-up. At the start of this process, it asked if I wanted to back up all my pictures on my PC. Declining means not being able to use the back-up system.6. Installing add on security features like Norton Safe Search is not user friendly. If you add 'safe-search' it affects something I use often. E.g. you are on a webpage and see a line of text you want to google. You can left-click and drag across it, then right click on it. Then there is an option to search google for that highlighted text. With Safe-Search enabled, Norton takes that over and displays Norton results and not Google results. I.e. changing your search engine. I have had to revert back to copying text I want to search on, and paste it into google.This is a far as I got. I gave up installing add-ons of any kind, because I could not be bothered with the hassle. Very likely I would not have liked how other features operate. There are a few features I am not even trying to use. To a certain extent I gave up exploring other general options too.The VPN is handy if you want to view region restricted content. However using a VPN on a regular basis is somewhat a pain. Wesites load noticabely slower. Some websites are blocked to VPNs, because VPN anonimity is what hackers use. Amazon Priome Video is 50/50 whether it will let you stream with the VPN on. If yu use the VPN day-today, you may have to turn it off to use Amazon Prime Video. ... Whereas other brand/manufacturer VPNs are fine.There are far too many pop-ups in the lower right side of your monitor. I don't mean good advice like 'this file is safe etc'. I mean stuff about do you want to buy a product to stop tracking cookies? Adverts and more than one type. Sometimes you'll get three over short period of time, and be swearing at having to close irritating ad pop-ups. Like what the hell is Norton doing contacting me on my PC desktop experience?

So back to using Bitdefender for my internet protection, and Surfshark is great for VPN at only ¬£2.29pm, where it allows me to watch all of my film apps like Netflix anywhere in the world.

In all my years (16 years +) of using, building and installing pc's into businesses, have I ever come across such a "fish in a barrel" scenario, where once they have your pc within their control.....there's a pop up most days offering essential additions to protect your important data. Hey user if you want VPN THEN PAY, ADDITIONAL PROTECTION, PAY. WE WILL LOOK AFTER YOUR SYSTEM, PAY. If you have watched Goodfellas, you get the pattern. We as a consumer will always seek a change for the better, and I fell for it. So back to using Bitdefender for my internet protection, and Surfshark is great for VPN at only ¬£2.29pm, where it allows me to watch all of my film apps like Netflix anywhere in the world.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 December 2023

Name: Norton 360 Premium 2024, Antivirus Software for 10 Devices and ‚Äé15 Month Subscription ‚Äéwith ‚ÄéAutomatic Renewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code ‚Äéby email
Reviews: It the first time I've used Norton for all my electronic items. It wasn't as easy to install as I was expecting as I use it on a few of mine and cover my husband's and sons items in the 10 products . I was really surprised that it picked up that one of my emails had been breached  a couple of years ago  that my old security had missed! I'll see how the next 15 months go but up to now I feel protected.

Name: Norton 360 Premium 2024, Antivirus Software for 10 Devices and ‚Äé15 Month Subscription ‚Äéwith ‚ÄéAutomatic Renewal, Includes Secure VPN and Password Manager, PC/Mac/iOS/Android, Activation Code ‚Äéby email

Reviews: Been sipping on Talisker Skye Single Malt Scotch Whisky recently, and it's a real journey for the taste buds. Here‚Äôs my take:Aroma - A Whiff of the Sea:Right off the bat, the aroma is intriguing. It's got this maritime quality to it, like a fresh sea breeze mixed with a hint of smoky peat. Definitely sets the scene for what's to come.Taste - Peat with a Sweet Twist:The first sip hits you with that classic Talisker peat, but it's not overwhelming. There's a sweet undercurrent ‚Äì think caramel and ripe fruits ‚Äì that balances the smokiness beautifully. It‚Äôs smooth with a slight spicy kick at the end.Finish - Lingering and Warm:The finish is where this whisky really shines. It leaves a warm, smoky taste that lingers pleasantly, inviting you back for another sip.Packaging - Classy and Understated:The bottle is pretty sleek, with a label that‚Äôs straightforward and classy. Looks good on the shelf and gives off a vibe of quality.Price - Good Value for the Experience:For the quality of whisky you‚Äôre getting, the price feels about right. It's not the cheapest single malt out there, but it‚Äôs reasonably priced for what it offers.Overall - A Must-Try for Whisky Fans:If you‚Äôre into your single malts and haven‚Äôt tried Talisker Skye yet, it‚Äôs definitely worth a go. It‚Äôs a great example of what the Isle of Skye has to offer ‚Äì a whisky with character, warmth, and a little bit of island magic.So, pour yourself a dram, sit back, and enjoy the ride!
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I am a big fan of a dark and stormy - a generous measure of Kraken into a fiery ginger beer, garnished with lime.  A litre bottle means more dark and stormies, so that's automatically a Good Thing.It is also regularly discounted, so can be a real bargain on here.  My favourite spiced rum in a decently sized bottle is always a five star review!
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I got this one at a great price in the sale.I like Kraken Rum, like Vanilla and Black Cherry so it seemed an ideal combination.  Happy to confirm that it really is, it's lovely.  Goes down smoothly on some ice.  Very tasty.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2023

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Fantastic alternative rum to some more well known brands, bit I am told it is fantastic and quite unique taste, but very well worth trying
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Spiced and Tasty.Very nice bootle.Very rich tasty
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 December 2023

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I like a quality rum even though I'm not a frequent drinker - more of a 'tippler' if the word exists and my previous purchase of Woods rum was I thought, my favourite but this is a different flavour altogether and even more palatable. I'd say it's now become my new favourite, particularly as it's a litre bottle. and was at a good price when I bought it. It's a pity the price increased by almost ¬£10 a few days after as I'd have bought another for the future but glad I got a bargain..
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Very smooth rum, and the combination of black cheery and vanilla gives it marzipan-like aftertaste. I was not sure initially but this is growing on me and works extremely well with fresh mango&apple juice and soda water (or smoothies - I do love me some Rum+Smoothie combo)
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Tastes lovely, drank it in 3 sitting so close to 230ml a go, which is not much considering 9 shots in total over like a 4/5 hour period with coke, felt more drunk than I have ever felt in my life I actually thought I had been poisoned and was going to die I'm guessing I had an allergic reaction to one of the ingredients as i have drank normal Kraken for years and never felt bad happened each time the same, struggling to stand/walk felt like I was 18 again and couldn't handle my alcohol, was very unsettling.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 January 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: This was the first time ordering alcohol online.  I was a bit sceptical as was half expecting it smashed.  However, it was very well packaged and would have been hard to smash.Bought as a gift for my brother, who loves this drink.  Not my type of tipple though.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I tried Kracken at a Beer Festival a few years ago and said I‚Äôd buy it, but fast forward to the end of 2023 to early 2024 I‚Äôve finally got round to buying this and the Black Cherry one.I can honestly say they both pack a punch.This variety of Kracken is best served over ice with either Vanilla or normal Coke, a shot in a glass of Irish Liquor over ice or even a teaspoon in a cuppa coffee.For me I have to say I‚Äôve tried a few coffee based liquors, however this is my ultimate favourite.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Now my favourite rum and only gets better when it is on offer :-)
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 December 2023

Reviews: This was the first time ordering alcohol online.  I was a bit sceptical as was half expecting it smashed.  However, it was very well packaged and would have been hard to smash.Bought as a gift for my brother, who loves this drink.  Not my type of tipple though.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I tried Kracken at a Beer Festival a few years ago and said I‚Äôd buy it, but fast forward to the end of 2023 to early 2024 I‚Äôve finally got round to buying this and the Black Cherry one.I can honestly say they both pack a punch.This variety of Kracken is best served over ice with either Vanilla or normal Coke, a shot in a glass of Irish Liquor over ice or even a teaspoon in a cuppa coffee.For me I have to say I‚Äôve tried a few coffee based liquors, however this is my ultimate favourite.

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I am a big fan of a dark and stormy - a generous measure of Kraken into a fiery ginger beer, garnished with lime.  A litre bottle means more dark and stormies, so that's automatically a Good Thing.It is also regularly discounted, so can be a real bargain on here.  My favourite spiced rum in a decently sized bottle is always a five star review!

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: I like a quality rum even though I'm not a frequent drinker - more of a 'tippler' if the word exists and my previous purchase of Woods rum was I thought, my favourite but this is a different flavour altogether and even more palatable. I'd say it's now become my new favourite, particularly as it's a litre bottle. and was at a good price when I bought it. It's a pity the price increased by almost ¬£10 a few days after as I'd have bought another for the future but glad I got a bargain..
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Very smooth rum, and the combination of black cheery and vanilla gives it marzipan-like aftertaste. I was not sure initially but this is growing on me and works extremely well with fresh mango&apple juice and soda water (or smoothies - I do love me some Rum+Smoothie combo)
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 February 2024

Name: Kraken Black Cherry and Madagascan Vanilla Black Spiced Rum 70cl
Reviews: Tastes lovely, drank it in 3 sitting so close to 230ml a go, which is not much considering 9 shots in total over like a 4/5 hour period with coke, felt more drunk than I have ever felt in my life I actually thought I had been poisoned and was going to die I'm guessing I had an allergic reaction to one of the ingredients as i have drank normal Kraken for years and never felt bad happened each time the same, struggling to stand/walk felt like I was 18 again and couldn't handle my alcohol, was very unsettling.

Name: Three Barrels Rare Old French Brandy VSOP, 70cl
Reviews: Always get it from Amazon. Never auto renewal or purchase directly from Kaspersky as they always charge you more
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 December 2023

Name: Three Barrels Rare Old French Brandy VSOP, 70cl
Reviews: Kaspersky total security is my favourite of the all in one security packages and this is my 4th year using it. Always uninstall and buy digitally from amazon - it‚Äôs about 1/3 the price of renewing.Not much has changed this year - same great product with a slightly (very slightly) updated user interface. New this year so far seems to be an improved software updater that‚Äôs a nice touch.Reason I use this is that It regularly scores highest on malware tests, and as a bonus comes with actually useful tools like webcam blocker, the update checker, privacy and security optimisation browser plug-ins and such, and is very light on system resources - I don‚Äôt need to turn it off to game for example. I‚Äôve bought a couple of computers that have come with trials of norton or trend micro and the just feel sub par by comparison.Minus 1 star from a perfect 5 for continuing to bundle kaspersky‚Äôs overpriced VPN software trial, and dumb region locking. The VPN can be removed post install by searching ‚Äòadd or remove programs‚Äô, but the region locking seemed particularly lazy.I didn‚Äôt notice when I bought this that it was UK only - that‚Äôs my bad, it says right on the page - but kaspersky‚Äôs enforcement is very lazy. I‚Äôm currently in Australia, but bought from the UK as my kaspersky account and payment card are still UK-based. It let me activate that serial fine (so no refund possibility) but then wouldn‚Äôt activate the software once downloaded even though the last one worked fine until the day before lol. They know my account, my history, my hardware, etc. it should work better. However all good as activated fine when using a VPN and no problems since with the VPN turned off.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2024

Name: Three Barrels Rare Old French Brandy VSOP, 70cl
Reviews: Kaspersky total security is my favourite of the all in one security packages and this is my 4th year using it. Always uninstall and buy digitally from amazon - it‚Äôs about 1/3 the price of renewing.Not much has changed this year - same great product with a slightly (very slightly) updated user interface. New this year so far seems to be an improved software updater that‚Äôs a nice touch.Reason I use this is that It regularly scores highest on malware tests, and as a bonus comes with actually useful tools like webcam blocker, the update checker, privacy and security optimisation browser plug-ins and such, and is very light on system resources - I don‚Äôt need to turn it off to game for example. I‚Äôve bought a couple of computers that have come with trials of norton or trend micro and the just feel sub par by comparison.Minus 1 star from a perfect 5 for continuing to bundle kaspersky‚Äôs overpriced VPN software trial, and dumb region locking. The VPN can be removed post install by searching ‚Äòadd or remove programs‚Äô, but the region locking seemed particularly lazy.I didn‚Äôt notice when I bought this that it was UK only - that‚Äôs my bad, it says right on the page - but kaspersky‚Äôs enforcement is very lazy. I‚Äôm currently in Australia, but bought from the UK as my kaspersky account and payment card are still UK-based. It let me activate that serial fine (so no refund possibility) but then wouldn‚Äôt activate the software once downloaded even though the last one worked fine until the day before lol. They know my account, my history, my hardware, etc. it should work better. However all good as activated fine when using a VPN and no problems since with the VPN turned off.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2024
